description: Generated when any of the general events like protocol up or
protocol down occurs

Summary.eval: ($v2 == 1) ? 'General event occured : protocol UP' : (($v2 == 2) ? 'General event occured : protocol DOWN' : 'General event occured : event type unspecified')

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstGenTrap JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress.1 s EXAMPL JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstGenTrapType i 0

description: The MAC address used by this bridge when it must
be referred to in a unique fashion. It is
recommended that this be the numerically smallest
MAC address of all ports that belong to this
bridge. However it is only required to be unique.
When concatenated with jnxMIMstCistBridgePriority or
jnxMIMstMstiBridgePriority a unique BridgeIdentifier
is formed which is used in the Spanning Tree Protocol.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress

description: Used within the Trap Notification PDU.
It denotes general events like
none - none of the below values
up - protocol UP
down - protocol DOWN
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstGenTrapType

description: Generated when any of the error events like memory failure or buffer failure
or protocol migration or new root or topology change occurs

Summary.eval: ($v2 == 1) ? 'Memory allocation failure' : (($v2 == 2) ? 'Buffer allocation failure' : 'Unspecified error event')

description: The MAC address used by this bridge when it must
be referred to in a unique fashion. It is
recommended that this be the numerically smallest
MAC address of all ports that belong to this
bridge. However it is only required to be unique.
When concatenated with jnxMIMstCistBridgePriority or
jnxMIMstMstiBridgePriority a unique BridgeIdentifier
is formed which is used in the Spanning Tree Protocol.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress

description: Used within the Trap Notification PDU.
It denotes general events like
none - none of the below values
memfail - memory allocation failure
bufffail - buffer allocation failure
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstGlobalErrTrapType

description: Generated whenever a new root bridge is selected in the topology.
The jnxMIMstNewRootTrap indicates that the sending agent has become
the new root of the Spanning Tree; the trap is sent by a bridge soon
after its election as the new root

event.Summary: New root bridge selected in topology

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstNewRootTrap JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress s EXAMPL JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstOldDesignatedRoot s EXAMPLEE JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstMstiBridgeRegionalRoot s EXAMPLEE JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstMstiInstanceIndex.1 i 1

description: The MAC address used by this bridge when it must
be referred to in a unique fashion. It is
recommended that this be the numerically smallest
MAC address of all ports that belong to this
bridge. However it is only required to be unique.
When concatenated with jnxMIMstCistBridgePriority or
jnxMIMstMstiBridgePriority a unique BridgeIdentifier
is formed which is used in the Spanning Tree Protocol.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress

description: The bridge identifier of the old root of the spanning
tree instance as determined by the Spanning Tree Protocol
as executed by this node.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstOldDesignatedRoot

description: MSTI Regional Root Identifier value for the Instance. This value
is used as the MSTI Regional Root Identifier parameter in all
Configuration Bridge PDUs originated by this node
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstMstiBridgeRegionalRoot

description: Spanning Tree Instance to which the information belongs.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstMstiInstanceIndex

description: Generated when topology change is detected
The MAC address used by this bridge when it must
be referred to in a unique fashion. It is
recommended that this be the numerically smallest
MAC address of all ports that belong to this
bridge. However it is only required to be unique.
When concatenated with jnxMIMstCistBridgePriority or
jnxMIMstMstiBridgePriority a unique BridgeIdentifier
is formed which is used in the Spanning Tree Protocol.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress

description: Spanning Tree Instance to which the information belongs.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstMstiInstanceIndex

description: Generated when port protocol migration happens in the port

event.Summary: Port protocol migration of type $v4 in port $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstProtocolMigrationTrap JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress.1 s EXAMPL JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstPortTrapIndex i 1 JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstForceProtocolVersion i 0 JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstPortMigrationType i 0

description: The MAC address used by this bridge when it must
be referred to in a unique fashion. It is
recommended that this be the numerically smallest
MAC address of all ports that belong to this
bridge. However it is only required to be unique.
When concatenated with jnxMIMstCistBridgePriority or
jnxMIMstMstiBridgePriority a unique BridgeIdentifier
is formed which is used in the Spanning Tree Protocol.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress

description: A unique value, greater than zero, indicating the Port number.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstPortTrapIndex

description: The version of Spanning Tree Protocol the bridge is
currently running. The value 'stpCompatible(0)'
indicates the Spanning Tree Protocol specified in
IEEE 802.1D and 'rstp(2)' indicates the Rapid Spanning
Tree Protocol specified in IEEE 802.1w and 'mstp(3)'
indicates the Multiple Spanning Tree Protocol Specified
in IEEE 802.1s.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstForceProtocolVersion

description: Port Protocol migration type occured in the port
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstPortMigrationType

description: Generated when the invalid packet is received for
bpdu/stp/rstp/maximum age/forward delay/hello time

event.Summary: Invalid packet of type $v3 received on port $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstInvalidBpduRxdTrap JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress s EXAMPL JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstPortTrapIndex i 1 JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstPktErrType i 0 JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstPktErrVal i 9999

description: The MAC address used by this bridge when it must
be referred to in a unique fashion. It is
recommended that this be the numerically smallest
MAC address of all ports that belong to this
bridge. However it is only required to be unique.
When concatenated with jnxMIMstCistBridgePriority or
jnxMIMstMstiBridgePriority a unique BridgeIdentifier
is formed which is used in the Spanning Tree Protocol.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress

description: A unique value, greater than zero, indicating the Port number.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstPortTrapIndex

description: Type of invalid packet received in each of the port
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstPktErrType

description: Packet error value corresponding to the above type
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstPktErrVal

description: Generated when the MST region's configuration
identifier changes.

event.Summary: Configuration identifier of MST region changed

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstRegionConfigChangeTrap JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress.1 s EXAMPL JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstMstiConfigIdSel i 0 JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstMstiRegionName s EXAMPLE JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstMstiRegionVersion i 9999 JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstMstiConfigDigest s EXAMPLE

description: The MAC address used by this bridge when it must
be referred to in a unique fashion. It is
recommended that this be the numerically smallest
MAC address of all ports that belong to this
bridge. However it is only required to be unique.
When concatenated with jnxMIMstCistBridgePriority or
jnxMIMstMstiBridgePriority a unique BridgeIdentifier
is formed which is used in the Spanning Tree Protocol.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress

description: The Configuration Identifier Format Selector used
by the Bridge. This has a fixed value of 0 to indicate
RegionName, RegionVersion are specified as in Standard.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstMstiConfigIdSel

description: The Name for the Region's configuration. By Default
Region Name will be equal to the Bridge Mac Address.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstMstiRegionName

description: Version of the MST Region.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstMstiRegionVersion

description: The Configuration Digest value for this Region.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstMstiConfigDigest

description: Generated when the ports Root-protect state (no-error or root-prevented)
for CIST changes.

event.Summary: Root-protect state for CIST on port $jnxMIMstCistPort has changed to $v2

description: The MAC address used by this bridge when it must
be referred to in a unique fashion. It is
recommended that this be the numerically smallest
MAC address of all ports that belong to this
bridge. However it is only required to be unique.
When concatenated with jnxMIMstCistBridgePriority or
jnxMIMstMstiBridgePriority a unique BridgeIdentifier
is formed which is used in the Spanning Tree Protocol.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress

description: Indicates whether the port was prevented from being a root port
for CIST. This parameter will always return 'no-error (0)' if
jnxMIMstCistPortRootProtectEnabled is FALSE.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstCistPortRootProtectState

description: Generated when the ports Root-protect state (no-error or root-prevented)
an MSTI changes.

event.Summary: Root-protect state for MSTI on port $jnxMIMstMstiPort has changed to $v2

description: The MAC address used by this bridge when it must
be referred to in a unique fashion. It is
recommended that this be the numerically smallest
MAC address of all ports that belong to this
bridge. However it is only required to be unique.
When concatenated with jnxMIMstCistBridgePriority or
jnxMIMstMstiBridgePriority a unique BridgeIdentifier
is formed which is used in the Spanning Tree Protocol.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress

description: Indicates whether the port was prevented from being a root port
for CIST. This parameter will always return 'no-error (0)' if
jnxMIMstCistPortRootProtectEnabled is FALSE.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstMstiPortRootProtectState

description: Generated when the ports Loop-protect state (no-error or loop-prevented)
for CIST changes.

event.Summary: Loop-protect state for CIST on port $jnxMIMstCistPort has changed to $v2

be referred to in a unique fashion. It is
recommended that this be the numerically smallest
MAC address of all ports that belong to this
bridge. However it is only required to be unique.
When concatenated with jnxMIMstCistBridgePriority or
jnxMIMstMstiBridgePriority a unique BridgeIdentifier
is formed which is used in the Spanning Tree Protocol.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstBrgAddress

description: Indicates whether a potential Loop was prevented on the port for CIST.
This parameter will always return 'no-error (0)' if
jnxMIMstCistPortLoopProtectEnabled is FALSE.
variables.name: JUNIPER-MIMSTP-MIB::jnxMIMstCistPortLoopProtectState

description: Generated when the ports Loop-protect state (no-error or loop-prevented)
an MSTI changes.

recommended that this be the numerically smallest
MAC address of all ports that belong to this
bridge. However it is only required to be unique.
When concatenated with jnxMIMstCistBridgePriority or
